body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/first-contribution.md#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-testing/testing.md
4. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
5. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

#### What type of PR is this?

<!--
Add one of the following kinds:
/kind bug
/kind cleanup
/kind documentation
/kind feature

Optionally add one or more of the following kinds if applicable:
/kind api-change
/kind deprecation
/kind failing-test
/kind flake
/kind regression
-->

/kind failing-test

#### What this PR does / why we need it:

#135553 is currently blocked on a failing test.

- likely caused by [this commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commit/294ff153426c4c47d2518c56b4c63b33cac93f35#diff-afb644eceb2c0d53027d3e3815f43f489b31b34d18f5402a626f2fbfd4b6eb52R501-R508)
- [discussion on #kubeadm](https://kubernetes.slack.com/archives/C2P1JHS2E/p1764754351115289)

#### Which issue(s) this PR is related to:
<!--
Please link relevant issues to help with tracking.

To automatically close the linked issue(s) when this PR is merged,
add the word "Fixes" before the issue number or link.
Do not use "Fixes" if the PR is of kind `failing-test` or `flake`.

Reference KEPs when applicable in addition to specific issues.

Examples:
Fixes #<issue number>
<issue link> (issue in a different repository)
KEP: https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/issues/<kep-issue-number>

If there is no associated issue, then write "N/A".
-->

#### Special notes for your reviewer:

a cleaner approach might be needed, but this should help unblock things to move the publishing bot rules PR forward.

#### Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?
<!--
If no, just write "NONE" in the release-note block below.
If yes, a release note is required:
Enter your extended release note in the block below. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".

For more information on release notes see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->
```release-note
NONE
```

#### Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.:

<!--
This section can be blank if this pull request does not require a release note.

When adding links which point to resources within git repositories, like
KEPs or supporting documentation, please reference a specific commit and avoid
linking directly to the master branch. This ensures that links reference a
specific point in time, rather than a document that may change over time.

See here for guidance on getting permanent links to files: https://help.github.com/en/articles/getting-permanent-links-to-files

Please use the following format for linking documentation:
- [KEP]: <link>
- [Usage]: <link>
- [Other doc]: <link>
-->
```docs

```

cc @neolit123 @pacoxu

title: Fix flaky TestApplyCRDuringCRDFinalization test

labels.name: sig/api-machinery
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.

labels.name: size/S
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: cncf-cla: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has signed the CNCF CLA.

labels.name: needs-ok-to-test
labels.description: Indicates a PR that requires an org member to verify it is safe to test.

labels.name: do-not-merge/release-note-label-needed
labels.description: Indicates that a PR should not merge because it's missing one of the release note labels.

labels.name: needs-priority
labels.description: Indicates a PR lacks a `priority/foo` label and requires one.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR lacks a `triage/foo` label and requires one.

labels.name: do-not-merge/needs-kind
labels.description: Indicates a PR lacks a `kind/foo` label and requires one.

body:
#### What type of PR is this?

<!--
Add one of the following kinds:
/kind bug
/kind cleanup
/kind documentation
/kind feature


Optionally add one or more of the following kinds if applicable:
/kind api-change
/kind deprecation
/kind failing-test
/kind flake
/kind regression
--> /kind flake

#### What this PR does / why we need it:
This PR fixes the flaky TestApplyCRDuringCRDFinalization test that was failing 
intermittently on slower systems (s390x architecture, race detector builds).

The root cause was a race condition where the test would attempt to apply a CR
immediately after requesting CRD deletion, without waiting for the CRD to
actually enter the terminating state. The fix explicitly waits for the CRD to
have a DeletionTimestamp set before attempting the apply operation.
#### Which issue(s) this PR is related to:
<!--
Please link relevant issues to help with tracking.

To automatically close the linked issue(s) when this PR is merged,
add the word "Fixes" before the issue number or link.
Do not use "Fixes" if the PR is of kind `failing-test` or `flake`.

Reference KEPs when applicable in addition to specific issues.

Examples:
Fixes #<issue number>
<issue link> (issue in a different repository)
KEP: https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/issues/<kep-issue-number>

If there is no associated issue, then write "N/A".
--> #135403 

#### Special notes for your reviewer:

The test was run multiple times (5x without race detector, 3x with race detector)
to verify the fix eliminates the flakiness. All related finalization tests
(TestFinalization, TestFinalizationAndDeletion, TestApplyCRDuringCRDFinalization)
pass consistently.

#### Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?
<!--
If no, just write "NONE" in the release-note block below.
If yes, a release note is required:
Enter your extended release note in the block below. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".


For more information on release notes see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
--> 
NONE
```release-note

```

#### Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.: NA

<!--
This section can be blank if this pull request does not require a release note.

When adding links which point to resources within git repositories, like
KEPs or supporting documentation, please reference a specific commit and avoid
linking directly to the master branch. This ensures that links reference a
specific point in time, rather than a document that may change over time.

See here for guidance on getting permanent links to files: https://help.github.com/en/articles/getting-permanent-links-to-files

Please use the following format for linking documentation:
- [KEP]: <link>
- [Usage]: <link>
- [Other doc]: <link>
-->
```docs

```

title: [BUG] Issue with k8s.io/apimachinery v0.34.2 and k8s.io/client-go v0.34.2

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: sig/cli
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR lacks a `triage/foo` label and requires one.

body:
### What happened?

When I launch a debug with vscode it failed, but that does not occur with `v0.34.1` versions.
```
Starting: /Users/go/bin/dlv dap --listen=127.0.0.1:57222 --log-dest=3 from /Users/data/src/test/k8s
DAP server listening at: 127.0.0.1:57222
Build Error: go build -o /Users/data/src/test/k8s/__debug_bin1159080801 -gcflags all=-N -l ./main.go
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:22:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/admissionregistration/v1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/admissionregistration/v1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:23:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/admissionregistration/v1alpha1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/admissionregistration/v1alpha1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:24:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/admissionregistration/v1beta1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/admissionregistration/v1beta1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:25:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/apiserverinternal/v1alpha1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/apiserverinternal/v1alpha1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:26:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/apps/v1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/apps/v1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:27:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/apps/v1beta1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/apps/v1beta1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:28:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/apps/v1beta2; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/apps/v1beta2
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:29:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/authentication/v1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/authentication/v1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:30:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/authentication/v1alpha1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/authentication/v1alpha1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:31:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/authentication/v1beta1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/authentication/v1beta1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:32:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/authorization/v1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/authorization/v1
../../../pkg/mod/k8s.io/client-go@v0.34.2/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:33:2: no required module provides package k8s.io/api/authorization/v1beta1; to add it:
	go get k8s.io/api/authorization/v1beta1 (exit status 1)
```

### What did you expect to happen?

It run and print hello 

### How can we reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)?

main.go
```
package main

import (
	"fmt"

	"k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/runtime"
	clientgoscheme "k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/scheme"
)

var (
	scheme = runtime.NewScheme()
)

func init() {
	_ = clientgoscheme.AddToScheme(scheme)
}
func main() {
	fmt.Println("hello")
}

```

go.mod

```
module sample

go 1.24.0

require (
	k8s.io/apimachinery v0.34.2
	k8s.io/client-go v0.34.2
)
```
run `go mod tidy` and then debug it with vscode

### Anything else we need to know?


### Kubernetes version

```console
$ kubectl version
# k8s.io/apimachinery v0.34.2
	k8s.io/client-go v0.34.2
```



### OS version
both linux and macos has this issue



### Install tools

body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/first-contribution.md#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-testing/testing.md
4. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
5. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

#### What type of PR is this?

/kind cleanup

#### What this PR does / why we need it:

There is a race condition where multiple pods are scheduled on the same node and the rpcbind command is executed
at the same time, which causes the unexpected setup failure for the second and subsequent pods.
Let's ignore this error and try to mount again.

```
I1202 04:28:43.711827 8802 dump.go:53] At 2025-12-02 04:13:43 +0000 UTC - event for pvc-volume-tester-writer-874x8: {kubelet bootstrap-e2e-minion-group-q3nq} FailedMount: MountVolume.SetUp failed for volume "pvc-27ae692b-5ea0-4d76-9ee7-d708e0feb4c7" : mount failed: exit status 1
Mounting command: /home/kubernetes/containerized_mounter/mounter
Mounting arguments: mount -t nfs -o relatime,vers=3 10.64.4.142:/export/pvc-27ae692b-5ea0-4d76-9ee7-d708e0feb4c7 /var/lib/kubelet/pods/96cddbc8-5129-4811-88d9-81db53af9229/volumes/kubernetes.io~nfs/pvc-27ae692b-5ea0-4d76-9ee7-d708e0feb4c7
Output: Mount failed: mount issued for NFS V3 but unable to run rpcbind:
 Output: rpcbind: another rpcbind is already running. Aborting

```

#### Which issue(s) this PR is related to:
<!--
Please link relevant issues to help with tracking.

To automatically close the linked issue(s) when this PR is merged,
add the word "Fixes" before the issue number or link.
Do not use "Fixes" if the PR is of kind `failing-test` or `flake`.

Reference KEPs when applicable in addition to specific issues.

Examples:
Fixes #<issue number>
<issue link> (issue in a different repository)
KEP: https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/issues/<kep-issue-number>

If there is no associated issue, then write "N/A".
-->

Fixes #135556

#### Special notes for your reviewer:

#### Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?
<!--
If no, just write "NONE" in the release-note block below.
If yes, a release note is required:
Enter your extended release note in the block below. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".

For more information on release notes see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->
```release-note
NONE
```

#### Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.:

<!--
This section can be blank if this pull request does not require a release note.

When adding links which point to resources within git repositories, like
KEPs or supporting documentation, please reference a specific commit and avoid
linking directly to the master branch. This ensures that links reference a
specific point in time, rather than a document that may change over time.

See here for guidance on getting permanent links to files: https://help.github.com/en/articles/getting-permanent-links-to-files
